p: The epidemiological surveillance of OROV is based on acute phase serology (IgM) [ 19, 27]. Serological tests depend on several factors, being the timing of sample collection stands out. Sampling is recommended 5Â days after the onset of symptoms in order to detect immunoglobulins in viremia peaks [ 19]. In Peru surveillance is done only with serological testing and limited only to regions in which the virus is endemic [ 28].
